list_definition.definition: in the recent past or not long ago

list_ex_of_english: Lately this subject has come under pressure from two new imperatives : perceived slowing of genetic progress and ambitious functional genomics.
Lately, different types of grammars are combined with agent-based systems.
Lately there had been an erosion of interest in experiment for its own sake.
Lately, the global coffee industry has changed radically; it has suffered a long cycle of lowest-ever world market prices caused by overproduction and technological change.
The council has broad interests, covering most fields of the natural sciences and medical research, as well as environmental issues and, lately, nutrition.
Lately, molecular biology techniques have been used as objective methods to distinguish between parasite species.
Lately, traditional land tenure has been blamed for environmental degradation of agricultural land.
Lately, the term "foundationalist" has been used to identify philosophical systems that regard mathematics as a system of ideal, absolutely certain knowledge.
